bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison thanks Hench for the print of the Cornwell painting for Lazear Hall.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 20, 1941

div1.p:
The picture painted by Cornwell and sent
by Mr. George A. Kellogg has arrived and is a beautiful
piece of work. Mr. Kellogg writes me that it is
entirely your conception and the result of your guidance.
I congratulate you upon this magnificent work and your
part in it and thank you for seeing to it that we have
received this print so beautifully framed and ready to
be hung in the Lazear Building.

I think I wrote you yesterday that Harriet
had been called West on account of her mother's illness.
Her first wire after arrival was that her mother was a
bit better, which I assume cannot mean too much in a
bad case of thrombosis.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
